page.title: 08Home Computers
page.content: My name is Mark. I enjoy programming the 64K Commodore computer which I keep in my bedroom on a special table. Besides the keyboard and processor I have a cassette player for loading programmes and use a T.V. set as a video display unit. I also have some joysticks. I type in small educational programmes for my younger sister. I share the computer with my Dad who uses it for his business; for stock- taking and calculating profit margins. Every couple of weeks I go with my friend to a computer shop in Ringwood to buy a new computer game. The shop assistant advises us which game to buy. When we get home we load in the new game and sometimes play all day. At the moment my favourites are the adventure games "The Hobbit" and "The Impossible Mission."
